net.parallaxed.bluejam.evolution
Interface NoteSequenceEvaluator

All Known Implementing Classes:
FitnessContour, FitnessDistance, FitnessInterval, FitnessRandom, FitnessStacked
public interface NoteSequenceEvaluator

Interface describes what arguments an implementing class (fitness function) must take. Like the NoteSequenceInitializer interface, the evaluators assume a singleton implementation, whereby the NoteSequences to be evaluated are passed in through the evaluate() function. NoteSequenceEvaluators may be "optimised" for different dataTypes, but the default implementation of evaluate() should return _some_ value for fitness, no matter what the NoteSequence type is. The implementing should throw an exception if required knowledge of the dataType is not found, or output a warning if knowledge was expected but not present. The Selector function should be strictly compatible with the type of value returned. In the default implementation, all fitness values are normalised (0-1).

Author:
Ciarán Rowe (csr2@kent.ac.uk)

Method Summary
 double evaluate(NoteSequence notes, PopulationParameters parameters)
          Evaluates the given NoteSequence, providing a double value for the fitness of that sequence.
 

Method Detail

evaluate

double evaluate(NoteSequence notes,
                PopulationParameters parameters)
Evaluates the given NoteSequence, providing a double value for the fitness of that sequence.

Parameters:
notes - The NoteSequence to Evaluate
parameters - The parameters of the individual/population
Returns:
A value for the fitness of the NoteSequence
